revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} [[File:Strakova akademie z Mánesova mostu (2).jpg|thumb|right|250px|The [[Straka Academy]], seat of the [[Government of the Czech Republic]], was raided by police.]]
The '''2013 Czech political corruption scandal''' started with a raid against organized crime which was conducted in the [[Czech Republic]] in June 2013 by the [[Police of the Czech Republic|Police]] Unit for Combating Organized Crime ({{lang-cs|Útvar pro odhalování organizovaného zločinu}}, ÚOOZ) and the Chief Public Prosecutor's Office ({{lang|cs|Vrchní státní zastupitelství}}) in [[Olomouc]]. It involved several highly positioned state officers and politicians, as well as controversial entrepreneurs and [[lobbyist]]s. The scandal affected the top levels of [[Czech politics]], including [[List of Prime Ministers of the Czech Republic|Prime Minister]] [[Petr Nečas]] and his [[Petr Nečas's Cabinet|coalition government]]. On 17 June 2013, it resulted in the resignation of the Prime Minister and the cabinet. Nečas also quit as leader of the [[Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)|Civic Democratic Party]] (ODS).
== Overview == The investigation of the case started in early 2012, according to Robert Šlachta, the head of the Unit for Combating Organized Crime. Ivo Ištvan, the Chief Public Prosecutor in Olomouc, confirmed that a total of 400 policemen were deployed in the raid.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/policie-pri-zatahu-jsme-nasli-150-milionu-a-desitky-kilogramu-zlata-p9w-/krimi.aspx?c=A130614_111235_krimi_jav|title=Při zátahu našla policie až 150 milionů a desítky kilogramů zlata|date=14 June 2013|work=Mladá fronta DNES|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
On 13 June 2013, some of the closest advisors and collaborators of the [[Czech Prime Minister]], including Jana Nagyová, Managing Director of the Section of the Prime Minister of the [[Czech Republic's Cabinet]], and Lubomír Poul, Director of the Office of the Government, were arrested in association with unspecified misconduct. Ondrej Páleník, former head of the [[Military Intelligence Service (Czech Republic)|Military Intelligence Service]]; Milan Kovanda, current head of the Military Intelligence Service;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.ihned.cz/politika/c1-60063860-policiste-zadrzeli-sefa-vojenske-rozvedky-kovandu-razie-probehla-i-v-jeho-uradu|title=Policisté zadrželi šéfa vojenské rozvědky Kovandu. Razie proběhla i v jeho úřadu|date=13 June 2013|work=[[Hospodářské noviny]]|publisher=iHNED|language=Czech|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref> [[Ivan Fuksa]], former Minister, and Petr Tluchoř, former Deputy, were among the arrested as well. The seat of the Government of the Czech Republic and offices of several influential Prague lobbyists were raided by police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lidovky.cz/zasahovali-jsme-na-vlade-na-pripadu-pracujeme-nekolik-mesicu-pra-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A130613_140816_ln_domov_ogo|title=Na vládě jsme zasahovali, zopakoval mluvčí policie. Odvedli si i šéfa úřadu Poula |last=Golis|first=Ondřej|date=13 June 2013|work=[[Lidové noviny]]|publisher=lidovky.cz|language=Czech|accessdate=13 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/14/world/europe/czech-police-raid-government.html?_r=0|title=Czech Police Raid Government Offices|last=Bilefsky|first=Dan|date=13 June 2013|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=13 June 2013}}</ref> The whereabouts of Petr Nečas after the arrests were not known, however, later he announced that his confidence in Nagyová "had not decreased". He also denied speculation about his resignation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lidovky.cz/necas-nemam-informace-o-zadne-trestne-cinnosti-svych-spolupracovniku-1el-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A130613_161703_ln_domov_ogo|title=Nerezignuji, Nagyové věřím dál, řekl nalezený Nečas|date=13 June 2013|work=Lidové noviny|publisher=lidovky.cz|language=Czech|accessdate=13 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.ihned.cz/cesko/c1-60061380-na-uradu-vlady-zasahovala-v-noci-policie|title=Všechno směřuje k zakázkám pražských kmotrů. V akci je 400 policistů|date=13 June 2013|publisher=[[Hospodářské noviny|iHNED.cz]]|language=Czech|accessdate=13 June 2013}}</ref>
On 14 June 2013, the Unit for Combating Organized Crime and the Chief Public Prosecutor's Office in Olomouc announced that Nagyová and members of the Military Intelligence Service had been accused of [[abuse of power]] and corruption. Nagyová, one of the closest collaborators of the Prime Minister, allegedly misused the Intelligence Service to monitor Nečas' wife (among others)<ref name="bbc">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-22903570|title=Czech PM Petr Necas under pressure as aide charged |date=14 June 2013|publisher=BBC|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> without the official approval of the [[Ministry of Defence (Czech Republic)|Defence Minister]] in late 2012. Her motives were, according to the police, purely private. Petr Nečas was in divorce proceedings when the scandal erupted.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rozhlas.cz/zpravy/politika/_zprava/sefka-necasova-kabinetu-si-udajne-objednala-u-vojaku-sledovani-premierovy-zeny--1224309|title=Šéfka Nečasova kabinetu si údajně objednala u vojáků sledování premiérovy ženy|last=Firbacherová|first=Pavla |date=14 June 2013|publisher=[[Czech Radio]]|language=Czech|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/15/world/europe/czech-police-charge-7-in-corruption-investigation.html?_r=0|title=Czech Police Charge Officials in Corruption Investigation|last=Bilefsky|first=Dan|date=14 June 2013|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref><ref name=idnes/>
[[File:Necas in Latvia (cropped).jpg|200px|right|thumb|[[Prime Minister of the Czech Republic|Czech Prime Minister]] [[Petr Nečas]] resigned to his office due to this affair ''(pictured in May 2013, one month before the raid)'']]
Additionally, the investigation targeted an organized group of lobbyists and state officers attempting to influence state institutions for their own enrichment. The Unit for Combating Organized Crime confiscated around [[CZK]] 120{{ndash}}150m ($7.8m<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/blogs/easternapproaches/2013/06/czech-politics-0|title=Is this the political end of Petr Nečas? |date=14 June 2013|publisher=The Economist|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>) in cash and tens of kilograms of gold during the raid. Eight people were charged with various offences.<ref name="idnes">{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/policie-pri-zatahu-jsme-nasli-150-milionu-a-desitky-kilogramu-zlata-p9w-/krimi.aspx?c=A130614_111235_krimi_jav|title=Při zátahu našla policie až 150 milionů a desítky kilogramů zlata|date=14 June 2013|work=[[Mladá fronta DNES]]|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/zeman-povazuje-obvineni-vznesena-v-kauze-nagyova-za-podlozena-p73-/domaci.aspx?c=A130615_114457_domaci_js|title=Zeman láme hůl nad Nečasem. Obvinění jsou podložená a vážná, říká|last=Kopecký |first=Josef |date=15 June 2013|work=Mladá fronta DNES|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>
Nečas, under pressure from opposition parties and politicians, repeated his refusal to resign.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/vyjadreni-premiera-necase-ve-snemovne-policejni-razie-pp6-/domaci.aspx?c=A130614_114147_domaci_jj|title=Nečas odsoudil postup policie, trafiky považuje za politickou dohodu|last=Jiřička|first=Jan |date=14 June 2013|work=Mladá fronta DNES|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref> He issued an apology for the actions of Jana Nagyová and denied that he was aware of it. He also announced her retirement from the office.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.ihned.cz/politika/c1-60075050-hluboce-lituji-a-omlouvam-se-reaguje-necas-na-sledovani-lidi-s-nagyovou-se-rozlouci|title=Hluboce lituji a omlouvám se, reaguje Nečas na sledování lidí. S Nagyovou se rozloučí|last=Niedermeierová|first=Jana |date=15 June 2013|publisher=iHNED|language=Czech|accessdate=16 June 2013}}</ref> [[ČSSD]], the major opposition party, announced its intention to invoke a [[vote of no confidence]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aktualne.centrum.cz/domaci/kauzy/clanek.phtml?id=782548|title=Soud rozhodne o vazbě. Premiér zatím odolává|date=14 June 2013|publisher=aktualne.centrum.cz|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> on 18 June 2013.
On 15 June, the District Court in [[Ostrava]] decided to take into custody Nagyová, Páleník, Tluchoř, Fuksa, Jan Pohůnek, former employee of the Military Intelligence Service, Marek Šnajdr, former Deputy, and Roman Boček, former employee of the Ministry of Agriculture.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rozhlas.cz/zpravy/politika/_zprava/byvaly-poslanec-za-ods-marek-snajdr-se-dnes-dozvi-jestli-skonci-ve-vazbe--1224860|title=Soud rozhodne, zda pošle Šnajdra do vazby. Tam už skončila Nagyová a dalších 5 obviněných|last=Čánová|first=Andrea |date=16 June 2013|publisher=Czech Radio|language=Czech|accessdate=16 June 2013}}</ref> Lubomír Poul was not charged and Milan Kovanda was released.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.novinky.cz/domaci/304949-soud-uvalil-vazbu-na-nagyovou-i-palenika.html|title=Soud uvalil vazbu na Nagyovou i Páleníka |date=15 June 2013|publisher=[[novinky.cz]]|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rozhlas.cz/zpravy/politika/_zprava/ostravsky-soud-uvalil-vazbu-i-na-byvaleho-poslance-ods-marka-snajdra--1224961|title=Ostravský soud uvalil vazbu i na bývalého poslance ODS Marka Šnajdra |last=Čánová|first=Andrea|date=16 June 2013|publisher=Czech Radio|language=Czech|accessdate=16 June 2013}}</ref>
On 16 June 2013, Petr Nečas announced that he would resign on Monday, 17 June 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/e4e8da5e-d6d9-11e2-9214-00144feab7de.html|title=Scandal forces Necas to quit as Czech PM|date=17 June 2013|publisher=[[Financial Times]]|accessdate=17 June 2013}}</ref> ''"I am fully aware of how the ups and downs of my personal life currently burden the political scene and ODS ... I want to emphasize that I'm aware of my political responsibility and I draw the consequences from that"'', he said.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lidovky.cz/klicove-jednani-koalice-sjizdeji-se-clenove-gremia-ods-ppo-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A130616_212823_ln_domov_hm|title=Nečas kauzu Nagyová neustál. Končí s ním celá vláda|date=17 June 2013|work=Lidové noviny|publisher=lidovky.cz|language=Czech|accessdate=17 June 2013}} (''"Jsem si plně vědom toho, jak peripetie mého osobního života v současné době zatěžují politickou scénu i ODS ... Chci zdůraznit, že jsem si vědom své politické odpovědnosti a vyvozuji z ní tyto důsledky."'')</ref>
On 16 July 2013, the [[Supreme Court of the Czech Republic]] in [[Brno]] decided in favour of three former members of the [[Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic]], Ivan Fuksa, Marek Šnajdr and Petr Tluchoř, on the grounds of their [[parliamentary immunity]] at the time of their involvement in the case. The three named persons were released from prison. Jana Nagyová and the other suspects were released from custody on 19 July 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rozhlas.cz/zpravy/politika/_zprava/1236751|title=Všichni obvinění v kauze Nagyová jsou na svobodě, jako poslední z vazby vyšel Jan Pohůnek|date=19 July 2013|publisher=Czech Radio|language=Czech|accessdate=22 July 2013}}</ref> According to the court, the danger of influencing witnesses has passed, as key witnesses have already been interrogated.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/propusteni-nagyove-z-vazby-dfx-/domaci.aspx?c=A130719_102405_domaci_jw|title=Nagyová, Páleník i ostatní jsou na svobodě, ovlivnění svědků už nehrozí|last=Wirnitzer|first=Jan |date=19 July 2013|work=Mladá fronta DNES|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=22 July 2013}}</ref>
According to the Czech news websites, Nečas married Nagyová on 21 September 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/svatba-petra-necase-ozenil-jana-nagyova-fck-/domaci.aspx?c=A130921_164445_domaci_skr|title=Bývalý premiér Nečas se podle bulváru oženil s Janou Nagyovou|date=21 September 2013|work=Mladá fronta DNES|publisher=iDNES|language=Czech|accessdate=22 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.ihned.cz/cesko/c1-60840070-necas-s-nagyovou-jsou-podle-bulvaru-manzele-svatbu-ale-utajili|title=Nečas s Nagyovou jsou podle bulváru manželé. Svatbu ale utajili|date=21 September 2013|work=[[Hospodářské noviny]]|publisher=iHNED|language=Czech|accessdate=22 September 2013}}</ref>
In February 2014, Nečas was charged with bribery.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-02-11/czech-ex-pm-charged-with-bribery-in-deal-that-toppled-him.html|title=Czech Ex-PM Charged With Bribery in Deal That Toppled Him |last=Laca|first=Petr|author2=Ponikelska, Lenka|date=12 February 2014|publisher=[[Bloomberg News]]|accessdate=12 February 2014}}</ref>
== Progress in further years ==
The case of misusing of [[Military Intelligence Service (Czech Republic)|Military Intelligence Service]] had been trialed by District Court of Prague 1 since November 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/necasiva-nagyova-a-zpravodajci-u-soudu-dyj-/krimi.aspx?c=A141119_151317_krimi_cen|title=Soud poprvé veřejně otevře kauzu Nagyová, 521 dní po Nečasově demisi|date=20 November 2014|work=iDNES.cz [online]|publisher=Mafra MF Dnes|language=Czech|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref> During the trial [[Petr Necas]] himself admitted he requested monitoring of his wife Radka Necasova in 2012 due to security risks connected with his role as PM.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/oduvodneni-verdiktu-v-kauze-nagyova-a-zpravodajcu-fwo-/domaci.aspx?c=A150826_100748_domaci_cen|title=Soudkyně uvěřila Nečasovi, že rodinu nechal sledovat on, ne Nagyová|date=26 August 2015|work=iDNES.cz [online]|publisher=Mafra MF Dnes|language=Czech|accessdate=26 August 2015}}</ref>
On 29 May 2015 the court acquitted all charged persons (including Jana Nagyová and military intelligence officers) of those particular charges while saying the monitoring of later PM’s spouse was not considered as any illegal wrongdoing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://domaci.ihned.cz/c1-64085620-soud-zprostil-janu-necasovou-obzaloby-hrozil-ji-az-3-5lety-trest|title=Soud zprostil Janu Nečasovou viny. Vojenské zpravodajství podle něj nezneužila|date=29 May 2015|work=Hospodářské Noviny [online]|publisher=HN|language=Czech|accessdate=29 May 2015}}</ref>
The public prosecutor refused such outcome and appealed immediately after court’s statement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://echo24.cz/a/wvJGc/obzaloba-proti-necasove-u-soudu-zkrachovala-istvan-se-divi|title=Obžaloba proti Nečasové u soudu zkrachovala, Ištvan se diví|date=29 May 2015|work=Echo24.cz [online]|publisher=Echo24|language=Czech|accessdate=29 May 2015}}</ref> Appeal court (Regional Court of [[Prague]]) reviewed the trial in April 2016 and annulled it because the District Court overlooked some evidence. Another trial was held but on 17 June 2016, all charged persons were acquitted of their charges once again.<ref>{{cite web|title=Trest za osvobození Nagyové. Státní zástupce hrozí odvoláním. Padla silná slova...|url=http://www.parlamentnilisty.cz/arena/monitor/Trest-za-osvobozeni-Nagyove-Statni-zastupce-hrozi-odvolanim-Padla-silna-slova-440838|website=Parlamentní Listy|accessdate=3 July 2016}}</ref>
== Analysis and conclusions == According to the Czech media and political commentators, the case consists of several more or less related parts. A leaked police document based on [[Telephone tapping|wiretapping records]] indicates that spying on the Prime Minister's wife by his managing director was prompted by personal motives and that the relationship between Nagyová and Nečas was more than collegial.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tyden.cz/rubriky/domaci/politika/zive-zatah-na-politiky-nagyovou-vyslychali-celou-noc_273366.html|title=Policisté odhalili Nagyovou při prověřování Janouška a Grygárka|date=14 June 2013|publisher=[[Týden]]|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> "We see a story that meets the quality parameters of a good Mexican [[telenovela]]", commented the newspaper ''[[Mladá fronta DNES]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.parlamentnilisty.cz/arena/monitor/Je-to-komedie-i-tragedie-pisi-deniky-o-premierove-Nagyove-275712|title=Je to komedie i tragédie,píší deníky o premiérově Nagyové|date=15 June 2013|publisher=Parlamentní listy|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>
The arrests and charging of several deputies were substantiated by the fact that they were rewarded by lucrative posts in exchange for their resignation and loyalty to the party ([[Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)|ODS]]) during an important parliamentary vote. While the police considers it to be a case of corruption, Nečas claims it was a standard political deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ceskatelevize.cz/ct24/domaci/231268-necas-nekonci-vyzvy-k-odstoupeni-nevyslysim/|title=Nečas nekončí: "Výzvy k odstoupení nevyslyším"|date=14 June 2013|publisher=[[Czech Television]]|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2013-06-13/czech-premier-battles-for-survival-as-police-detain-close-aide|title=Czech Illegal Spy Scandal Threatens Necas as Officials Held (5)|last=Laca|first=Peter|date=14 June 2013|publisher=[[Businessweek]]|accessdate=15 June 2013|display-authors=etal}}</ref> Nečas found himself among the suspects, as he had promised and provided the bribe to the deputies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hn.ihned.cz/c1-60096530-policie-petr-necas-nabizel-uplatek|title=Policie: Petr Nečas nabízel úplatek|last=Surmanová|first=Kateřina|date=19 June 2013|work=Hospodářské noviny|publisher=iHNED|language=Czech|accessdate=19 June 2013}}</ref>
The large police operation also focused on activities of influential Prague entrepreneurs and lobbyists, namely [[Roman Janoušek]] and Ivo Rittig. The investigative authorities raided their offices in association with suspicious activities related to investments made by the Magistrate of the Capital City of Prague and other state-controlled subjects.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ceskatelevize.cz/ct24/exkluzivne-na-ct24/231176-smeruje-razie-k-janouskovi-a-rittigovi-oba-jsou-spojovani-s-pochybnymi-tendry/|title=Směřuje razie k Janouškovi a Rittigovi? Oba jsou spojováni s pochybnými tendry|date=13 June 2013|publisher=Czech Television|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> Both Janoušek and Rittig were outside the country at the time of the raid.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lidovky.cz/rittig-janousek-hrdlicka-i-toman-kmotri-figuruji-v-policejnim-spisu-1id-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A130614_165149_ln_domov_khu|title=Rittig, Janoušek, Hrdlička i Toman. Kmotři figurují v policejním spisu k případu Nagyová|date=14 June 2013|work=[[Lidové noviny]]|publisher=lidovky.cz|language=Czech|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>
The police investigation was prompted by suspicion that Libor Grygárek, a former Deputy at the Chief Public Prosecutor's Office in Prague, was in connection with an organized group of entrepreneurs abusing state contracts (Janoušek and Rittig were among suspected).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ceskenoviny.cz/zpravy/policiste-nagyovou-odhalili-pri-proverovani-grygarka-a-janouska/951308|title=Policisté Nagyovou odhalili při prověřování Grygárka a Janouška|date=14 June 2013|work=[[ČTK]]|publisher=České noviny|language=Czech|accessdate=16 June 2013}}</ref> Grygárek was neither arrested nor charged with any crime at that time. In December 2013, he was charged with misuse of power in 2009.<ref>http://www.novinky.cz/krimi/321816-policie-obvinila-byvaleho-elitniho-zalobce-grygarka.html</ref> In February 2014, Ivo Rittig was arrested and charged with money laundering in a separate case.<ref>http://aktualne.centrum.cz/czechnews/clanek.phtml?id=801533</ref>
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
[[Category:2013 in the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Corruption in the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Crime in the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)]] [[Category:Government crises]] [[Category:Petr Nečas]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox food | name = Arabic tea | image = [[Image:Arabic tea.jpg||260px]] | caption = Two glasses of Arabic tea | alternate_name = Shay 'arabiyy | country = [[Arab world]] | region = Arab World | national_cuisine = [[Arab cuisine]] | year = | mintime = | maxtime = | type = [[Tea]] | course = [[Drink]] | served = [[List of hot drinks|Hot]] }} [[Image:Morocco-Eastern-Beverage-Arabic-Tea-Ethnic-1046535.jpg|thumb|widthpx|Arabic teapot in Morocco]] '''Arabic tea''' ({{Lang-ar|شاي عربي}}; shay ʿarabiyy <small>Arabic pronunciation:</small> {{IPA-ar|šāy||Tea pronunciation in Arabic.ogg}}) Is a variety of hot teas popular throughout the [[Arab world]]. It is commonly served to guests and [[Corporate law|business partners]] at [[meeting]]s and [[Party|social events]], and has been drunk by Arab people for centuries.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.pilotguides.com/articles/syrian-drinks-repast-in-a-teacup/|title=Syrian Drinks - Syrian Tea - Arab Culture and Hospitality -|work=The Official Globe Trekker Website|access-date=2017-04-07|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://prezi.com/r-upyncstrij/famous-arabic-tea/|title=Arabian Tea|website=prezi.com|language=en|access-date=2017-04-07}}</ref> It is considered to be a healthy drink largely because boiling water kills of most of the bacteria and viruses that would otherwise cause sickness, and some claim that they offer additional medicinal advantages.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://theteaspot.com/tea-traditions.html|title=Tea Traditions, Tea Culture of the World, Tea History {{!}} TEA SPOT|website=theteaspot.com|access-date=2017-04-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nutrizonia.com/arabic-sage-tea/|title=Arabic Sage Tea - :: Nutrizonia ::|date=2016-02-01|work=:: Nutrizonia ::|access-date=2017-04-07|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Arab society == Tea is an important drink in the Arab world and is usually served with breakfast, after lunch, and with dinner. For Arabs, tea denotes [[hospitality]], and is typically served to guests. It is also common for [[Arabs]] to drink tea with dates, which acts as a sweetener. It owes its popularity to its social nature; tea is one of the most important aspects of hospitality and business etiquette in [[Arab culture]]. Importantly, one should not reject tea when offered, because it can be considered rude.
== Varieties == There are many different types of Arabic tea: [[File:Tea and peanuts.jpg|thumb|Arabic tea in [[Libya]] with Peanuts]] [[image:The menthe.jpg|thumb|right|220px|Maghrebi Mint tea in [[Morocco]]]] [[Image:شاي أحمر.JPG|thumb|widthpx|Black Tea in [[Tunisia]]]] *''[[Salvia officinalis | Sage]]'' ({{lang-ar|مريمية}}; Maryamiya) tea is typically served after a meal to aid in digestion and eliminate gas or heartburn. It has a distinct flavor, and, if brewed without black tea, is non-caffeinated. Homegrown, dried sage leaves are considered best for making Sage Arabic Tea.<ref>{{cite web|title=Maramia- Sage Tea {{!}} Rooted In Salt|url=http://www.rootedinsalt.com/2014/07/maramia-sage-tea/|website=Rooted In Salt|date=31 July 2014}}</ref> *''[[Chamomile]]'' ({{lang-ar|بابونج}}; bābūnaj) tea is made by brewing dried chamomile flowers and has many health benefits, including reducing stress and anxiety, alleviating pain and discomfort, and also improving sleep and insomnia.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chai Babooneh - Chamomile Tea|url=http://turmericsaffron.blogspot.ch/2012/11/chai-babooneh-chamomile-tea.html|website=turmericsaffron.blogspot.ch}}</ref> *''[[Anise]]'' ({{lang-ar|يانسون}}; Yānsūn) tea has been well known for hundreds of years.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anise Tea (Yansoon) - Taste of Beirut|url=http://www.tasteofbeirut.com/anise-tea-yansoon/|website=Taste of Beirut|date=24 October 2009}}</ref> *''[[Thyme]]'' ({{lang-ar|زَعْتَر}}; [[Za'atar|Za'tar]]) tea helps improve memory and cleans out the stomach. Rich in antioxidants, this tea is also useful in preventing aging from within.<ref>{{cite web|title=11 Promising Benefits of Za'atar {{!}} Organic Facts|url=https://www.organicfacts.net/health-benefits/herbs-and-spices/zaatar.html|website=www.organicfacts.net}}</ref> *''[[Cardamom]]'' ({{lang-ar|هال}}; Hal) tea is very common in the Arab world, and is known for its strong aroma. It is sometimes mixed with coffee, and is said to help digestion and increase saliva flow. It is drunk before meals to prepare digestive enzymes. Although one of the most expensive spices in the world, cardamom is still largely harvested by hand for many Arab customers. *''[[Maghrebi mint tea]] (at-tāy)'': ({{lang-ar|الشاي}} ''aš-šāy''; [[Maghrebi Arabic]]: التاي ''at-tāy'') also known as Moroccan mint tea, is a [[green tea]] prepared with [[spearmint]] leaves and sugar, traditional to the [[Maghreb]] region (the northwest African countries of [[Morocco]], [[Algeria]], [[Tunisia]], [[Libya]], and [[Mauritania]]). The tea was originally made by English traders and has spread in popularity throughout Africa, France, and other neighboring countries. Known for its flavor and vitality, the fresh mint used to prepare the at-tāy helps to clear the palate after meals.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://moroccanfood.about.com/od/tipsandtechniques/ss/How-To-Make-Moroccan-Mint-Tea.htm|title=How to Make the Perfect Pot of Moroccan Mint Tea|last=|first=|date=|work=|newspaper=About.com Food|access-date=2016-10-21|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.organicauthority.com/eco-chic-table/the-art-of-moroccan-mint-tea-and-how-to-brew-it.html|title=The Art of Moroccan Mint Tea and How to Brew It|last=|first=|date=|website=Organic Authority|publisher=|access-date=2016-10-21}}</ref> *''[[Mentha | Mint]] (Na’nā’)'' ({{lang-ar|شاي بالنعناع}}; ''shay bil na’nā’'') tea is commonly used to get over colds, a sore throat, sinus congestion, and stomach ulcers. Seasonal allergies can also be treated by drinking cups of tea containing rosemarynic acid: an anti-inflammatory agent found in mint. *''[[Black Tea]]'' ({{lang-ar|شاي أحمر}}; shay ʾaḥmar; Literally: "Red tea") is the most common, usually the brand name Lipton.<ref>{{cite web|title=Syrian Drinks - Syrian Tea - Arab Culture and Hospitality -|url=http://www.pilotguides.com/articles/syrian-drinks-repast-in-a-teacup/|website=The Official Globe Trekker Website}}</ref> *''[[Roselle (plant)|Hibiscus]]'' ({{lang-ar|كركديه}}; karkaday) tea is drunk hot in the winter and cold in the summer. [[Hibiscus tea]] has a large amount of vitamin C. *''[[Kuwaiti tea|Cinnamon tea]]'' also [[Kuwaiti tea]] ({{lang-ar|الشاي بالقرفة}}; shay bālqrfh) is created by putting water in a boiler together with cinnamon sticks and sugar. Cinnamon tea contains many health benefits such as bacterial resistance, diabetes treatment, protection against heart disease, and prevention of colon disorders, as well as containing many antioxidant compounds.<ref>{{cite web|title=9 Benefits of Cinnamon|url=https://www.xn--lgbbz3e9a.net/herbs/cinnamon-health-benefits-and-side-effects|website=Benefits|language=ar-AR|date=10 February 2016}}</ref> *''[[Dried lime tea]]'' ({{lang-ar|شاي لومي}}; shay noomi) also known as chai noomi basra, noomi basra tea or loomi tea, is a type of herbal tea made from dried limes that is traditional to [[Iraq]], [[Kuwait]], [[Oman]] and [[United Arab Emirates]].
== Served == Tea in the Arab world is usually a strong dark mix, similar to the so-called "breakfast tea" served in other parts of the world. Often brewed with sugar and served in long glasses, it can also be made with mint or cardamom, or with a dash of milk. In Yemen, black tea is brewed in water and milk.<ref>[http://www.shebayemenifood.com/content/yemeni-tea Yemeni Tea]. shebayemenifood.com. 05.30.2012.</ref>
==See also== *[[Arab culture]] *[[Arab cuisine]] *[[Arabic coffee]] *[[Libyan tea]] *[[Shahi Haleeb]] *[[Tea Culture]] *[[Tea in Turkey|Turkish Tea]]
==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Levantine cuisine}}

{{other uses}} '''Cartoon violence''' is the representation of [[Violence|violent actions]] involving [[animation|animated]] characters and situations. This may include violence where a character is unharmed after the action has been inflicted.
==Debates== People have different views about cartoons and the violence within them. Some researchers believe that high level of [[violence in cartoons]] can make children more aggressive.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1159766/Cartoon-violence-makes-children-aggressive.html |title=Cartoon violence 'makes children more aggressive' |last=Clark |first=Laura |publisher=Associated Newspapers |location=London |date=2009-03-06}}</ref> Their studies also found that young children tend to mimic the negative behavior they see on television. Output aimed at children as young as seven, which include a number of cartoons, had the highest levels of violence.
Some researches on the other hand believe that people need to consider the ways in which children process information, the amount of mental effort they invest, and their own life experience to gain an understanding of how television violence affects children. For instance recent research has indicated that children do not appear to mimic acts of violence in the media, whether television or cartoons.<ref>Christopher J. Ferguson, (2010) "[http://www.tamiu.edu/~cferguson/Video%20Games%201%20Year.pdf Video Games and Youth Violence: A Prospective Analysis in Adolescents] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120525061300/http://www.tamiu.edu/~cferguson/Video%20Games%201%20Year.pdf |date=May 25, 2012 }}", ''Journal of Youth and Adolescence''</ref> Blumberg, Bierwirth and Schwartz argue that children possess the ability to differentiate real life from animation, as well as the ability to understand right from wrong. They know that violent acts qualify as immoral and infringe on the welfare of others, therefore the violence witnessed in cartoons will register as "make believe" to children and will not be applied into their real lives.<ref name=Blumberg>{{cite journal|author=Blumberg, Bierwirth and Schwartz|title=Does Cartoon Violence Beget Aggressive Behavior in Real Life? An Opposing View|doi=10.1007/s10643-008-0280-1|journal=Early Childhood Educ J|date=26 August 2008|pages=102|publisher=Springer Science+Business Media|subscription =yes}}</ref>
==Options for Parents and Restriction== There are a number of ways parents can control their children’s exposure to violence. One of the most effective and common ways of prevention is restricting the amount and types of programs children watch. With older children, parents might want to discuss, and explain television. This can help children to understand television material and overcome the effect [[Television violence|TV violence]] has on their outlook and behaviors.
Three initiatives have been put in place to combat violence in cartoons (<ref>{{cite journal|title=Cartoon Violence: Is it as Detrimental to Preschoolers as we Think?|journal=Early Childhood Education Journal|date=2002-03-01|first=Kristen|last=Peters|author2=Fran Blumberg|volume=29|issue=3|pages=143–149|id= |url=|type = PDF}}</ref>). The first is The [[Children's Television Act]] which requires [[Broadcasting|broadcaster]]s to air shows which are [[education]]al and provide information for the children. The second initiative is the [[V-chip]] [[legislation]] that gives parents the opportunity to block out violent shows from their television. The third legislation against violent cartoons is the National Cable Television Association’s [[TV Parental Guidelines]], which is a system that rates the [[Television show]]s based on their contents
In [[Action (fiction)|action]]-[[Adventure (genre)|adventure]] oriented cartoons, the most consistent avenue of addressing violence is the use of a form of [[fantasy violence]] in which no one is injured or killed onscreen. In science fiction cartoons, for example, enemy forces are typically said to be [[robot]]s so that they may be destroyed in bulk by the heroes without concern over killing living beings. In cases where vehicles are known to be piloted by living beings, [[tank]]s, [[aircraft]], and other war vehicles that are destroyed in combat always allow time for the [[aviatior|pilot]] to escape or bail out. Realistic [[firearm]]s are often replaced with futuristic [[beam weapon]]s which still seldom hit anyone. Swords and other [[bladed weapon]]s may be prohibited from being used as offensive weapons but may be used defensively or be depicted as magical weapons. Direct violence is frequently limited to [[hand to hand combat]] where directly kicking or punching another character may or may not be allowed. The majority of action adventure cartoons over the past decades have used these methods of depicting dynamic action scenes although their use has been heavily criticized as "sanitized violence". Cartoons based on the [[Voltron]], [[Transformers]], [[G.I. Joe]], and [[Masters of the Universe]] franchises (especially the versions produced during the 1980s) are notable examples using variations on fantasy violence.
Additionally, parents should limit the total screen time for children older than two years of age to no more than one to two hours per day. Children under two years of age should avoid watching television altogether. Televisions should be kept out of children’s bedrooms and parents should watch television with their children and discuss the content.<ref name=Strasburger>{{cite journal|author=Strasburger, V. |author2=Jordan, A. |author3=Donnerstein |last-author-amp=yes |title=Health Effects of Media on Children and Adolescents|date=2010}}</ref>
Health practitioners can also play their part by taking the time to ask their young patients how much time per day they spend with entertainment media and if there is a television or computer with Internet access in their bedroom.<ref name=Strasburger/>
==Effects== {{Main|Media violence research}} Effects of cartoon violence on youth remain controversial. Research has generally been divided on this issue with no consensus reached regarding the effects of violence on behavior.<ref>Steven Kirsh, (2006) "[Cartoon violence and aggression in youth]", ''Aggression and Violent Behavior''</ref> That being said, the impact of exposure to violence may remain regardless of whether children choose to imitate it.<ref name=Blumberg/>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
{{Animation}}
[[Category:Adolescence]] [[Category:Animation]] [[Category:Violence]]

revision.text:
'''Casualty estimation''' is the process of estimating the number of injuries or deaths in a battle or natural disaster that has already occurred. On the other, [[casualty prediction]] is the process of estimating the number of injuries or deaths that might occur in a planned or potential battle or natural disaster.
Measures used to imply casualties include: * Reported number of kills * Number of enemy individual weapons captured after engagement * Number of tanks and aircraft lost * Remote sensing of mass graves
==Methods==
[[MASINT|Measurement and signature intelligence]] alone cannot give a reasonable estimate of casualties. What [[Electro-optical MASINT#Spectroscopic MASINT|Spectroscopic MASINT]] can do is help find mass graves. [[Geophysical MASINT]] can help localize metal and possibly bodies at that site. [[TECHINT]] is needed if there are weapons or artifacts to analyze. IMINT has a role to play in tracking movements. These all have to combine with all-source analysis. Perhaps the losses of tanks and aircraft, if available, might better predict what actually happened in a battle. [[Electro-optical MASINT#Mass graves|MASINT's mass graves capability]] is a means that has been used for remote sensing of clandestine mass graves.
Author Sam Adams' book, ''War of Numbers'' discusses, in great detail, a process of casualty estimation. Adams was a CIA analyst who eventually resigned over what he felt was political manipulation of casualty figures in the [[Vietnam War]]. He explains how he came up with casualty figures for the NLF and PAVN. Adams, and other U.S. analysts dealing with a guerilla war in jungle, found there were better metrics than "body count". [[David Hackworth]], for example, used number of enemy weapons captured after an engagement, and that turned out to be a good predictor of casualties, with certain limits.
==Earthquakes== {{main|Earthquake casualty estimation}} Recent advances are improving the speed and accuracy of loss estimates immediately after [[earthquakes]] (within less than an hour) so that injured people may be rescued more efficiently. After major and large earthquakes, rescue agencies and [[civil defense]] managers rapidly need quantitative estimates of the extent of the potential disaster, at a time when information from the affected area may not yet have reached the outside world. For the injured below the rubble every minute counts. To rapidly provide estimates of the extent of an earthquake disaster is much less of a problem in industrialized than in developing countries. This article focuses on how one can estimate earthquake losses in developing countries in real time.
==See also==
* [[Body count]] * [[Casualty prediction]] * [[Loss Exchange Ratio]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080212164246/http://ww2.csfs.ca/CSFS_Journal.aspx?ID=46&year=2006 Related article in Canadian Society of Forensic Science Journal]
{{Intelligence cycle management}}

'''Charitable prom organizations''' are groups, primarily in the [[United States]], that give away [[prom]] dresses to high school girls who may not be able to otherwise afford them. One such group, [[The Glass Slipper Project]], works with [[Chicago]] area girls. The project has been discussed on the website for ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]''<ref>[http://www.oprah.com/uyl/volunteer/children/vol_children_atrisk_08.jhtml]</ref> and in the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]''.<ref>[http://www.chicagotribune.com/features/lifestyle/chi-0402230203feb23,0,4053973.story?coll=chi-leisuretempo-hed]</ref> [[The Perfect Prom Project]] is active at the [[University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign]].
Charitable prom organizations in the US are listed on donatemydress.org.<ref>[http://donatemydress.org donatemydress.org] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110304054952/http://donatemydress.org/ |date=March 4, 2011 }}</ref> Some prom retail stores are also charitable prom organizations. Synchronicity Boutique <ref>[http://www.synchronicityboutique.com www.synchronicityboutique.com]</ref> donated over $10,700 to 240 local high schools that purchased dresses from their store in Baltimore.
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Lists of organizations]] [[Category:Children's charities based in the United States]] [[Category:Prom]]

{{Rights in Colombia}} {{see also|Child labor|Military use of children}} '''Children' rights in Colombia''' ({{lang-es|Derechos de los niños en Colombia}}) is the status of [[children's rights]] in the [[Republic of Colombia]]. Colombia signed the [[Convention on the Rights of the Child]] in 1989 and later ratified the CRC on September 2, 1990.<ref>[http://www.colombiaaprende.edu.co/html/home/1592/article-76046.html {{es icon}} Colombiaaprende.edu.co: Unidos por los niños y las niñas]</ref> Internally issues related to children are mostly under the ''[[Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar]]'', or the ICBF, which is translated as the Colombian Institute for Family Welfare.
The average school-leaving age in Colombia is 12. The numerous [[Wars involving Colombia|internal conflicts]] in which Colombia has been involved, has used children for combat related duties throughout the years, as well as political, social and economic instability have pushed for child labor. More recently the current [[Colombian armed conflict|internal armed conflict]], while the government enforces the enlistment of adults in the military under the legal age, 18-year-olds, the [[guerrilla movements in Colombia|guerrillas]] and [[Paramilitarism in Colombia|paramilitary groups]] resort to the recruitment, sometimes forced, of children for combat. Between 11,000 and 14,000 children are estimated to be involved with left-wing guerrilla groups and right-wing paramilitaries in [[Colombia]]. According to [[Human Rights Watch]], "Approximately 80 percent of child combatants in Colombia belong to one of the two left-wing guerrilla groups, the [[Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia|FARC]] or [[National Liberation Army (Colombia)|ELN]]. The remainder fights in [[paramilitary]] ranks."<ref>[http://hrw.org/english/docs/2005/02/22/colomb10202.htm Colombia: Armed Groups Send Children to War] [[Human Rights News]] a website of [[Human Rights Watch]] February 22, 2005</ref>
Moreover the children are also affected by the violence of war and the forced displacement that has come with it. Colombia has one of the highest number of victims of [[land mine]]s in the world, most of the victims being children.
== Emmanuel == In 2002, FARC guerrillas kidnapped presidential candidate [[Ingrid Betancourt]] and secretary [[Clara Rojas]]. A general rumor spread that Rojas was pregnant in captivity after a relationship with a guerrilla leader. This was later confirmed by [[John Frank Pinchao]], a policeman who was also in captivity under the FARC along Betancourt and Rojas and escaped. Pinchao said that Rojas had a child in captivity named Emmanuel and he was being raised by the guerrillas.<ref>[http://www.liberenaemmanuel.org/welcome/ Free Emmanuel] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071010113220/http://www.liberenaemmanuel.org/welcome/ |date=October 10, 2007 }}</ref>
===Child sexual abuse=== Child pornography and [[Sexual slavery|sexual exploitation]] are issues in Colombia. Children are mainly affected by [[Poverty in Colombia|poverty]] and end up in local brothels; others are placed into regional and international prostitution trade networks. These networks are often run by bigger cartels associated to [[Illegal drug trade in Colombia|illegal drug trade]], weapons smuggling, and counterfeiting. Children end up in local brothels; others are placed into regional and international prostitution trade networks. These networks are often run by bigger syndicates also involved in narcotics, weapons, and counterfeiting. Children may be traded to neighboring countries like Venezuela, or to markets in countries as distant as Spain or Germany.<ref>[http://www.wunrn.com/news/2007/09_07/09_17_07/092307_colombia.htm womensnewsnetwork WUNRN: “A Child in Danger is a Child that Cannot Wait” – Colombia and Child Prostitution in Today’s World] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080514123606/http://www.wunrn.com/news/2007/09_07/09_17_07/092307_colombia.htm |date=May 14, 2008 }}</ref> Children may be traded to neighboring countries like [[Venezuela]], or to markets in countries in [[Europe]], the [[Middle East]] or [[Asia]].<ref>[http://www.semana.com/wf_InfoArticulo.aspx?idArt=107846 {{es icon}} Revista Semana: Child commercial sexual violence is the third illegal most lucrative business in the world]</ref>
== See also == * [[List of children's rights topics]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080222223135/http://www.unicef.org/colombia/03-uniencol.htm UNICEF - Colombia] * {{es icon}} [http://www.icbf.gov.co/ Colombian Institute for Family Welfare (ICBF)] * {{es icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20071211032615/http://www.ninosdepapel.org/espanol/modules.php?name=Content&pa=showpage&pid=5 Ninos de Papel Foundation]
[[Category:Children's rights by country|Colombia]] [[Category:Colombian law]] [[Category:Human rights in Colombia]] [[Category:Childhood in Colombia|Rights]] [[Category:Children's rights in South America|Colombia]]

The objective of '''combat assessment''' is to identify recommendations for the course of military operations.
The determination of the overall effectiveness of force employment during military operations. Combat assessment is composed of three major components: *[[battle damage assessment]] (BDA) *[[munitions effects assessment]] *[[reattack recommendation]].
The GS-3 is normally the single point of contact for combat assessment at the joint force level, assisted by the joint force GS-2.
[[Category:Military operations]] [[Category:Military science]] [[Category:Military theory]]
{{military-stub}}

revision.comment: Returned the original word. article about U.K. defence would be correct.
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Refimprove|date=February 2010}} {{Globalize/UK|date=December 2010}} {{Criminal defenses}} {{Tort law|defenses}}
The '''defence of property''' is a common method of [[Justification (jurisprudence)|justification]] used by [[Legal defense|defendants]] who argue that they should not be held liable for any loss and injury that they have caused because they were acting to protect their [[property]]. [[Court]]s have generally ruled that the [[use of force]] may be acceptable.
==English Law== Generally, see [[self-defence in English law]]. In addition to the right of self-defence at [[common law]], section 3 of the [[Criminal Law Act 1967]] states that :A person may use such force as is reasonable in the circumstances in the prevention of crime or in arresting offenders or suspects.
Insofar as an attack on property is a crime, reasonable force may be used to prevent the crime or to arrest the offender, whether it be [[theft]] of a sum of money or the [[Criminal Damage Act 1971|damage]] of an object. In many cases of [[robbery]] and [[burglary]], the threat will be to both a person and property, and this combination can be a powerful defence. In ''AG's Reference (No 2 of 1983)'' (1984) 1 AER 988<ref>{{cite BAILII | litigants =Attorney-General's Reference No 2 of 1983 | link = | country = | court = EWCA | division = Crim | year = 1984 | num = 1 | para = | eucase = | parallelcite = [1984] QB 456 | date = 3 February 1984 | courtname = [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales|Court of Appeal]] | juris = }}</ref> Lane CJ. held that a defendant who manufactured ten petrol bombs to defend his shop during the [[Toxteth Riots]] could set up the defence of showing that he possessed an explosive substance "for a lawful purpose" if he could show he acted to protect himself or his family or property by means he believed reasonably necessary to meet the attack. In theory, the defence of property by itself cannot reasonably provide a justification for inflicting serious injury, but there are a number of cases approving considerable violence to arrest criminals threatening property.
Although ''R v Scully'' (1824) 171 ER 1213 held that it was not justifiable to shoot an intruder merely to arrest him, on the facts, “the life of the prisoner was threatened, and if he considered his life in actual danger, he was justified in shooting the deceased as he had done; but if, not considering his own life in danger, he rashly shot this man, who was only a trespasser, he would be guilty of manslaughter.” See [[self-defence (Australia)]] for a comparative view on whether the use of excessive force causing death should give rise to a mitigatory defence and "Reform" below. In ''Mead and Belt's Case'' (1823) 68 ER 1006. Holroyd J. instructed a jury that violence could not be used against a civil trespasser, adding: “But, the making an attack upon a dwelling, and especially at night, the law regards as equivalent to an assault on a man's person; for a man's house is his castle and therefore, in the eye of the law, it is equivalent to an assault."
One recent case on using force against a burglar is ''[[Tony Martin (farmer)|Anthony Martin]] v R'' (2001) EWCA 2245,<ref>{{cite BAILII | litigants = Martin v R | link = Tony Martin (farmer) | country = | court = EWCA | division = Crim | year = 2001 | num = 2245 | para = | eucase = | parallelcite = [2002] 2 WLR 1, [2002] 1 Cr App R 27, [2003] QB 1 | date = 30 October 2001 | courtname = [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales|Court of Appeal]] | juris = }}</ref> which resulted in the householder being convicted. As the law currently stands, a person in possession can use no more force than they reasonably believe necessary to remove a trespasser from the premises. Further, where the threat to the land or its possession is not immediate, and other measures could be taken that would make force unnecessary (e.g., calling the police or seeking remedies through the courts) the defence will normally be lost. But in ''Chamberlain v Lindon'' (1998) 1 WLR 1252<ref>{{cite BAILII | litigants = Chamberlain v Lindon | link = | country = | court = EWHC | division = Admin | year = 1998 | num = 329| para = | eucase = | parallelcite = | date = 18 March 1998 | courtname = [[High Court of Justice|High Court]] | juris = }}</ref> Lindon demolished a wall to protect a [[right of way (public throughway)|right-of-way]], honestly believing that it was a reasonable means of protecting his property (and, incidentally, avoiding litigation). It was held that it was not necessary to decide whether Lindon’s action was justified as a matter of civil law.
For the purpose of the criminal law, what mattered was whether Lindon believed that his actions were reasonable. Although this case is on the specific interpretation of the statutory defence under s5 [[Criminal Damage Act 1971]], the fact that the defendant was not out of time after nine months of inaction is interesting. On a similar statutory defence, ''DPP v Bayer and Others'' (2004) 1 Cr. App. R. 493<ref>{{cite BAILII | litigants = Director of Public Prosecutions v Bayer & Ors | link = | country = | court = EWHC | division = Admin | year = 2003 | num = 2567 | para = | eucase = | parallelcite = [2004] 1 WLR 2856 | date = 4 November | courtname = [[High Court of Justice|High Court]] | juris = }}</ref> dealt with defence of private property as a defence to aggravated trespass under section 68 of the [[Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994]].
The court held that if defendants argued they had used reasonable force to defend property from actual or imminent damage that would constitute a criminal act, then the court had to consider whether, on the facts as the defendants honestly believed them to be, the force used was reasonable in all the circumstances.
==Reform==
The defence of "private defence" or "protective force," when unlawful force is used or threatened against a person who may use proportionate force to defend persons or property, is distinguished from the line of authority concerned with a similar defence against trespassers. In the Law Commission's Report No. 218 ''Offences Against the Person and General Principles'' (1993)<ref><!-- {{cite BAILII}} only works for case reports --> ''Legislating the Criminal Code: Offences against the Person and General Principles (Report)'' [http://www.bailii.org/ew/other/EWLC/1993/218.html [1993] EWLC 218] (1 January 1993)</ref> at pp 106–110) these defences are set out (so far as they relate to defence of property) as follows: :27(i) The use of force by a person for any of the following purposes, if only such as is reasonable in the circumstances as he believes them to be, does not constitute an offence: ::(c) to protect his property... from trespass; ::(d) to protect property belonging to another from . . . damage caused by a criminal act or (with the authority of the other) from trespass... :29(i) For the purposes of s 27... ::(a) a person uses force in relation to... property not only where he applies force to, but also where he causes an impact on,... that property;"
==See also==
[[Castle Doctrine]]
==References== <references/> * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060110134623/http://www.lawcom.gov.uk/docs/cp173apps.pdf Law Commission], ''Partial Defences to Murder: Overseas Studies'' Consultation Paper No 173 (Appendices)
{{DEFAULTSORT:Defence Of Property}} [[Category:Criminal defenses]] [[Category:Tort law]] [[Category:Self-defense]]

{{Use American English|date=September 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox video game | title = Dishonored: Death of the Outsider | image = Death of the Outsider cover.jpg | developer = [[Arkane Studios]] | publisher = [[Bethesda Softworks]] | director = [[Harvey Smith (game designer)|Harvey Smith]] | designer = Dinga Bakaba | programmer = Hugues Tardif | artist = Sébastien Mitton | writer = {{Unbulleted list|Sachka Duval|Sophie Mallinson|Anna Megill|Hazel Monforton}} | composer = [[Daniel Licht]] | engine = | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[PlayStation 4]]|[[Xbox One]]}} | released = 15 September 2017 | genre = [[Action-adventure game|Action-adventure]], [[Stealth game|stealth]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Dishonored: Death of the Outsider''''' is an [[Action-adventure game|action-adventure]] [[Stealth game|stealth]] [[video game]] developed by [[Arkane Studios]] and published by [[Bethesda Softworks]]. It is a standalone expansion pack following ''[[Dishonored 2]]'', and was released 15 September 2017 on [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]]. It follows former-assassin Billie Lurk as she finds her mentor Daud and aids in his quest to kill [[The Outsider (Dishonored)|the Outsider]], a supernatural being who bestows magical powers on a select few. ==Gameplay== The gameplay is more or less the same as in ''[[Dishonored]]'' and ''[[Dishonored 2]]''. The player is equipped with a short sword. If the player sneaks up on a foe, they can stab them to death quickly and quietly. The player also has other gear, such as a wrist-mounted crossbow, land mines, and grenades. A new piece of gear in this game is the hook mine, which grabs a nearby enemy and knocks them unconscious.{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/dishonored-2-death-of-the-outsiders-hook-mines-look-very-cool/ |title=Dishonored 2 Death of the Outsider's Hook Mines look very, very cool |last=Donnelly |first=Joe |date=6 September 2017 |work=PC Gamer |access-date=6 September 2017}} After the first mission, the player gains access to three supernatural abilities. Unlike previous games in the series, the player does not purchase them with "runes"; they are all fully unlocked from the start. These abilities cost energy to use, but unlike in the previous games, the player's energy regenerates fully on its own; there are no energy-replenishing consumables. Lurk's main mobility power is "Displace", which allows her to set a marker in the world, and then teleport that marker at any time.{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/billies-displace-ability-sounds-awesome-in-dishonored-2-death-of-the-outsider/ |title=Billie's 'displace' ability sounds awesome in Dishonored 2: Death of the Outsider |last=Donnelly |first=Joe |date=13 June 2017 |work=[[PC Gamer]] |access-date=2 September 2017}} "Semblance" allows the player to take the faces of living NPCs and use them as a temporary disguise, though they can only take a character's face once. The disguise drains power as the player moves, but not when they are standing still.{{cite web |url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2017/09/15/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider-best-power/ |title=Evasion of the bodysnatcher in Dishonored: Death Of The Outsider |last=Meer |first=Alec |date=15 September 2017 |work=Rock, Paper, Shotgun |access-date=25 September 2017}} Using Semblance on specific named NPCs may produce unique interactions. Completing the game unlocks an "original game plus" mode, where the player has access to some powers featured in ''[[Dishonored 2]]''. As in the previous games, the player can collect "bonecharms", which are scattered throughout the levels. Wearing a bonecharm provides minor upgrades to the player's abilities. During missions, the player may pick up optional "Contracts" at black markets, which are side missions that involve doing tasks such as assassinating another character.{{cite web |url=https://www.engadget.com/2017/08/26/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider/ |title='Dishonored' gets unleashed in 'Death of the Outsider' |last=Hardawar |first=Devindra |date=26 August 2017 |publisher=Engadget |access-date=2 September 2017}} In one example, the character is tasked with killing a mime and making it look like a suicide. ==Plot== After the events of ''[[Dishonored 2]]'', Emily Kaldwin is reinstated as empress and begins to salvage the Empire previously broken by Delilah's rule. Billie Lurk wakes aboard her ship, the Dreadful Wale, having a recurring nightmare regarding her right arm and eye. Billie has tracked down her old mentor Daud's whereabouts to a boxing club in Albarca Baths. She makes her way to Daud's location, finding that the boxing club is run by a Void-worshiping cult called the Eyeless. Lurk witnesses Daud being restrained by a special device that cancels out his Void-given powers. She disables the device, thereby freeing Daud. Daud is happy to see Billie and asks for her help in one last job: killing the Outsider, to which Lurk agrees. On board the Dreadful Wale, Daud explains that the Eyeless are in possession of a ritual knife, a special blade that was originally used to create the Outsider thousands of years ago. Daud surmises that the blade will allow Billie to kill the Outsider. Billie is then visited by the Outsider, who gives her a cryptic message, whilst simultaneously replacing her right arm with a Void-made arm, and her eye with a special red artifact, the Sliver of the Eye. The arm gives Lurk supernatural abilities. Billie makes her way into the city once again to investigate the leadership of the Eyeless. Upon figuring out the identities of the leaders, Billie steals two keys to a safety deposit box in Karnaca's largest bank. She is able to infiltrate the bank and steal the knife, while also discovering that one of the Eyeless' leaders attempted to abandon the group and hid important documents in the Royal Conservatory. Once Billie retrieves the knife, the Outsider appears and explains that he knows more than most, revealing that Daud had died of natural causes aboard the Dreadful Wale while Billie was on the heist, much to her dismay. She returns to the Dreadful Wale and cremates her mentor's deceased body, thus also burning down the Dreadful Wale (an anagram of 'Farewell Daud'). Billie then infiltrates the Royal Conservatory, where she finds the documents. They detail the location of a Void portal at an abandoned mine outside Karnaca. Billie travels to the mine, which is now overseen and operated by the Cult that originally created the Outsider. The Cult members discuss occult sciences while marveling at the Void creatures walking about near the dig site. Billie learns from their notes that the Mark of the Outsider is actually his name, written in an esoteric script that only the dead can read. Billie makes her way to an artifact called the Eye of the Dead God and absorbs it, allowing her to safely enter the Void portal. Once inside the Void, Billie makes her way to the Ritual Hold, where the Outsider resides. There she finds the Outsider, seemingly bound and immobile. Billie is then given a choice, to either return the Outsider to the mortal realm by having Daud's Void spirit pronounce the Outsider's real name to him, or to use the ritual knife to kill the Outsider. Either way, the Outsider is displaced, and Billie acknowledges that with the Outsider gone, the world will be changed in innumerable ways. However, the Void will continue to exist and there is no longer anybody who can decide who will gain its power. ==Development== Dinga Bakaba, lead designer of ''[[Dishonored 2]]'', was one of the initial voices for making the ''Death of the Outsider'' standalone.{{cite web |url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider-lets-players-cut-/1100-6452891/ |title=Dishonored: Death Of The Outsider Lets Players Cut Loose As It Closes Out The Main Story |last=Fillari |first=Alessandro |date=26 August 2017 |publisher=GameSpot |access-date=2 September 2017}} The game removes the chaos system featured in previous games, which tracked how many characters the player killed and altered the world depending on if the player had a high bodycount. Developers felt that removing the need to find elixirs, which were previously required to fully restore energy, encouraged players to experiment more with the full range of powers. Giving all the powers at once was "liberating" for Arkane, as they knew the full extent of what any player could do at any point in the game. Time restraints meant that levels couldn't all be "themed" in the same way ''Dishonored 2''{{'}}s levels were, though some levels are intended to make the player rely on different powers than others. Co-creative director Harvey Smith had immediate concerns about the semblance power when it was first pitched, as he felt implementing the idea appropriately would take an excessive amount of work; ultimately the full extent and ramifications of the power were reduced to more "manageable" levels, and Smith was glad for its inclusion.{{cite web |url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/dishonored-2/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider-semblance |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider delivers on the social stealth we were promised a decade ago |last=Peel |first=Jeremy |date=29 August 2017 |publisher=PCGamesN |access-date=3 September 2017}} ''Death of the Outsider'' is meant to bring an end to "the Kaldwin era", an arc that began in the first ''[[Dishonored]]'' with the assassination of Jessamine Kaldwin and followed characters involved with it, such as [[Corvo Attano]] and [[Emily Kaldwin]].{{cite web |url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2017/08/23/gamescom-2017-why-death-of-the-outsider-is-the-end-of-dishonored-as-we-know-it |title=Gamescom 2017: Why Death of the Outsider is the End of Dishonored as We Know It |last=O'Brien |first=Lucy |date=23 August 2017 |publisher=IGN |access-date=2 September 2017}} Whether any future ''Dishonored'' games will be made is undecided, but would feature different characters as their protagonists.{{cite web |url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2017/08/25/quakecon-2017-future-dishonored-games-would-feature-different-characters |title=Quakecon 2017: Future Dishonored Games Would Feature Different Characters |last=Osborn |first=Alex |date=25 August 2017 |publisher=IGN |access-date=2 September 2017}} ==Reception== {{expand section|date=October 2017}} {{Video game reviews | MC = PC: 81/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider for PC Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=4 July 2018}}
PS4: 82/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider for PlayStation 4 Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=4 July 2018}}
XONE: 84/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider for Xbox One Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=4 July 2018}} | GSpot = 8/10{{cite web |url=https://www.gamespot.com/reviews/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider-review/1900-6416761/ |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider Review |last=Fillari |first=Alessandro |date=18 September 2017 |website=[[GameSpot]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive Inc.]] |accessdate=18 November 2017}} | IGN = 8.4/10{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/09/16/dishonored-death-of-the-outsider-review |title=Dishonored: Death of the Outsider Review |last=Marks |first=Tom |date=16 September 2017 |work=IGN |accessdate=17 September 2017}} }} [[IGN]]'s Tom Marks considered it "a worthy end", but felt it didn't reach the "high bar" of ''Dishonored 2''. Marks praised the "wonderfully detailed" levels and the encouragement to use abilities more liberally, though expressed mixed feelings at the removal of the Chaos system and lack of character progression. Alessandro Fillari at ''[[GameSpot]]'' gave the game a positive review, praising the level design and individual missions, while also criticizing the story, stating that "while starting strong, the story eventually runs out of steam." ''[[GamesRadar+]]'' ranked it 19th on their list of the 25 Best Games of 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/best-games-2017/ |title=The best games of 2017 |author=GamesRadar staff |date=22 December 2017 |website=[[GamesRadar+]] |publisher=[[Future plc]] |accessdate=25 March 2018}} The game was nominated for Best Expansion in ''[[PC Gamer]]''{{'s}} 2017 Game of the Year Awards.{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/nominees-pc-gamer-goty-2017/ |title=Games of the Year 2017: The nominees |author=PC Gamer staff |date=8 December 2017 |website=[[PC Gamer]] |publisher=Future plc |accessdate=28 January 2018}} ===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Award !! Category !! Result !! Ref |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="1" | 2017 | rowspan="1" | [[Golden Joystick Awards]] | Studio of the Year (Arkane Studios) | {{Nom}} | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;" | {{cite web |url=https://www.bestinslot.co/golden-joystick-awards-2017-nominees/ |title=Golden Joystick Awards 2017 Nominees |last=Gaito |first=Eri |date=13 November 2017 |website=Best in Slot |accessdate=28 January 2018}} |- | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="2" | 2018 | rowspan="1" | [[Writers Guild of America Awards 2017]] | Outstanding Achievement in Videogame Writing | {{Nom}} | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;" | {{cite web |url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/best-video-game-writing-nominees-announced-see-the/1100-6456061/ |title=Best Video Game Writing Nominees Announced, See Them All Here |last=Makuch |first=Eddie |date=11 January 2018 |website=GameSpot |publisher=CBS Interactive Inc. |accessdate=12 January 2018}} |- | rowspan="1" | [[National Academy of Video Game Trade Reviewers]] Awards | Art Direction, Period Influence | {{Nom}} | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;" | {{cite web |url=http://navgtr.org/archives/3351/ |title=Nominee List for 2017 |website=[[National Academy of Video Game Trade Reviewers]] |date=9 February 2018| accessdate=15 February 2018}}{{cite web |url=http://navgtr.org/archives/3365/ |title=Horizon wins 7; Mario GOTY |website=National Academy of Video Game Trade Reviewers |date=13 March 2018 |accessdate=14 March 2018}} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Arkane Studios}} {{Dishonored series}} [[Category:2017 video games]] [[Category:Action-adventure games]] [[Category:Arkane Studios games]] [[Category:Dystopian video games]] [[Category:Fantasy video games]] [[Category:First-person adventure games]] [[Category:Gangs in fiction]] [[Category:Government in fiction]] [[Category:Fiction about murder]] [[Category:Fiction about the paranormal]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:Fiction about psychic powers]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Fiction about spirit possession]] [[Category:Stealth video games]] [[Category:Steampunk video games]] [[Category:Video game sequels]] [[Category:Video games about revenge]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]] [[Category:Video games with alternate endings]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox One games]] [[Category:Video game expansion packs]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 Pro enhanced games]]

{{distinguish|Nenets people}} {{Infobox ethnic group | group = Enets
''энцы'' | image = | caption = | population = '''{{circa}} 260''' | popplace = | region1 ={{flagicon|Russia}} [[Russia]] | pop1 =227{{spaces|2}}(2010) | ref1 =[http://www.gks.ru/free_doc/new_site/population/demo/per-itog/tab5.xls Всероссийская перепись населения 2010. Национальный состав населения РФ 2010] | region2 = {{UKR}} | pop2 = 26{{spaces|2}}(2001) | ref2 = {{cite web|author=|datepublished=|url=http://2001.ukrcensus.gov.ua/rus/results/nationality_population/|title=Всеукраїнський перепис населення 2001. Русская версия. Результаты. Национальность и родной язык|lang=|publisher=|7=|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6171e8TFd?url=http://2001.ukrcensus.gov.ua/rus/results/nationality_population/|archivedate=2011-08-21|deadurl=yes|df=}} | languages = [[Enets language|Enets]] | related = [[Nenets_People|Nenets]], [[Nganasans]] }} The '''Enets people''' ({{lang-ru|энцы}}, ''entsy''; singular: {{lang|ru|энец}}, ''enets''), or Yenetses, Entsy, Entsi, Yenisei, Yenisei-Samoyed, Yenisey Samoyeds or Yeniseian people are a [[indigenous people|traditionally nomadic people]] who live on the east bank, near the mouth, of the [[Yenisei River]]. Many live in the village of [[Potapovo]] in [[Krasnoyarsk Krai]] in western [[Siberia]] near the [[Arctic Circle]]. According to the [[Russian Census (2010)|2010 Census]], there are 227 Enets in [[Russia]]. In [[Ukraine]], there were 26 Entsi in 2001, of whom 18 were capable of speaking the language. The [[Enets language]] is a [[Samoyedic languages|Samoyedic]] language, formerly known as Yenisei Samoyedic (not to be confused with the [[Yeniseian languages|Yeniseian]] language family, which is completely unrelated). They still speak their language, but education is in Russian so there is fear they may lose their language. ==Current situation== British travel writer [[Colin Thubron]] visited the town of Potapovo in the late 1990s and found the Entsi deculturated and demoralized, beset with problems of [[alcoholism]]. The [[reindeer]] [[collective farm|collective]] established in [[Nikita Khrushchev]]'s day had been severely impacted by [[acid rain]] from the [[nickel]] [[smelter]]s at [[Norilsk]]. A [[fur farm]] that raises [[fox]] was similarly diminished. About half the population was unemployed with a few employed in [[reindeer]] herding on the west side of the river, the remainder living by fishing in the Yenisei River. Fisherman from Potapovo sometimes catch red [[sturgeon]] and ''[[Omul]]'', a type of [[salmon]], as well as [[Salvelinus|char]], [[gang fish]], and [[northern pike]]. Thubron mentions a salted [[muksun]] fish product. Some social services continue to be provided by the Russian government: a small hospital, with a doctor and a few nurses; schools (although older children must attend in [[Dudinka]] to the north); and small [[Russian government]] [[pension]]s. The electric plant had recently burned and electricity was provided intermittently by a generator. Life expectancy is 45 with many dying violent deaths due to family violence and fighting. ==See also== * [[List of indigenous peoples of Russia]] ==Further reading== * ''[[The Red Book of the Peoples of the Russian Empire]]'', {{ISBN|9985-9369-2-2}} This book may be ordered from its Estonian publisher at https://web.archive.org/web/20040217225839/http://www.redbook.ee/english.html *[[Colin Thubron]], ''In Siberia'', HarperCollins, 1999, hardcover, 287 pages, {{ISBN|0-06-019543-6}}; British editions, Chatto & Williams or [[Sinclair Stevenson]], October, 1999, hardcover, 320 pages, {{ISBN|1-85619-798-0}}; trade paperback, Penguin, September, 2000, 384 pages, {{ISBN|0-14-026860-X}} ==Citations== *[http://www.eki.ee/books/redbook/enets.shtml Article on the Enets in ''The Red Book of the Peoples of the Russian Empire'' online version] *Adapted from the [[Wikinfo]] article, "Enets" https://web.archive.org/web/20070927211239/http://www.internet-encyclopedia.org/wiki.phtml?title=Enets March 3, 2004 ==References== [[Category:Ethnic groups in Siberia]] [[Category:Ethnic groups in Russia]] [[Category:Ancient peoples]] [[Category:Indigenous peoples of North Asia]] [[Category:Samoyedic peoples]] [[Category:Krasnoyarsk Krai]] [[Category:Indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North, Siberia and the Far East]] [[Category:Indigenous peoples in the Arctic]] [[Category:Modern nomads]] {{Uralic peoples}} {{Indigenous peoples of Russia}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox Organization |name = Gemma |image = |image_border = |size = |caption = |map = |msize = |mcaption = |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = 1976 |extinction = |type = Organisation for lesbians with disabilities |status = |purpose = Social networking and support group |headquarters = [[England]] |location = |region_served = [[England]] |membership = |language = [[English language|English]] |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organisation = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = |remarks = }} '''''GEMMA''''' is a magazine and a social group founded in 1976 whose mandate is to provide a "friendship and support group for [[disabled]] [[lesbians]] in [[England]]".<ref name=inventing>{{cite book |last=Beckett |first=Elsa |title=Inventing Ourselves |publisher=Routledge |year=1988 |isbn=0-415-02959-7 |pages=68–9}}</ref>
The organisation was founded by members of lesbian organisation [[Sappho (organisation)|Sappho]] and mixed organisation [[Campaign for Homosexual Equality]], including Elsa Beckett.<ref name=inventing /> Gemma's member newsletter was published in regular print, in [[braille]] as well as [[Compact Cassette|cassette]] format.<ref>Horn, Sandy. Gaia's guide 1990: Europe, Australia, New Zealand, Israel, U.S.A., Canada, Mexico, 1990, {{ISBN|0-947922-02-4}} p112</ref><ref>[http://home.vicnet.net.au/~alga/collection.htm Australia Lesbian & Gay Archives] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121004214835/http://home.vicnet.net.au/~alga/collection.htm |date=October 4, 2012 }}</ref>
In her essay ''Unearthing Our Past: Engaging with Diversity at the Museum of London'', Raminder Kaur describes a leaflet promoting the activities of Gemma, which is a part of the [[Museum of London]] collection, as "crucial to exploring the theme of multiple identities or difference within difference".<ref>Kaur, Raminder. ''Unearthing Our Past: Engaging with Diversity at the Museum of London'' accessed Feb 5,2012 http://www.museumoflondon.org.uk/Collections-Research/Research/Your-Research/RWWC/Essays/Essay1/KaurEssay8.htm</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|LGBT}} * [[List of lesbian periodicals]]
==References== {{Reflist|1}}
[[Category:Disability and sexuality]] [[Category:Disability media]] [[Category:English LGBT-related magazines]] [[Category:Intersectional LGBT topics]] [[Category:Lesbian-related magazines]] [[Category:LGBT history in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:LGBT organisations in England]] [[Category:Magazines established in 1976]] [[Category:Lesbian organisations based in the United Kingdom]]
{{LGBT-org-stub}}
